content: One of my back-burner goals is to one day figure out how to use any ordering other than SeqCst. Do y'all have any favorite resources for learning about how to use the orderings correctly?

The paper that made it click for me is https://plv.mpi-sws.org/sra/paper.pdf (slides: https://www.cs.tau.ac.il/~orilahav/papers/popl16.pdf). But I am not sure how accessible that is to non-PL-researchers.^^
Very interesting proposal for a different memory model

yeah it's slightly different from RA but very similar (the same without write-write races). one can obtain exactly RA using the same technique with a slight variation, and most intuition carries over.
This section describes proper C++ release/acquire in the same style (i.e., as a variant of "strong release acquire").
